title.narrative: AUC,Gender Peace and Security JFA, GPSP 2015-16
AUC,Gender Peace and Security JFA, GPSP 2015-16

description.narrative:
Insatsen består av ett stöd till Gender, Peace and Security programmet (GPSP), som ligger under AUC:s avdelning för fred och säkerhet (Department for Peace and Security). Programmet har som målsättning att integrera jämlikhet i den Afrikanska Fred- och Säkerhetsarkitekturen (APSA) och att förbättra kvaliteten och effektiviteten hos de institutioner och mekanismer som ansvarar för att förhindra våld, inklusive sexuellt- och genusgrundat våld, och att addresera frågor rörande att skydda civila i konflikt- och postkonflikt situationer.
Insatsen bedöms vidare ha tillräckligt goda planer för att tillfredsställande genomföra sina planer, och en tillräckligt god kapacitet till att genomföra uppföljning av aktiviteter inom programmet. Dessutom bedöms insatsens budget och finansiering vara tillfyllest för att Sida ska besluta att stödja insatsen.

The programme will contribute towards policy development and debate in the field of gender, peace and security and protection with a view to contributing towards more coordinated programming in this area by the AU, the UN, the RECs, INGO, CSOs and other multi-lateral and bi-lateral partners working on these issues in Africa.

The Gender Peace and Security Programme (GPSP) aims at mainstreaming gender into the African Peace and Security Architecture (APSA) and improving the quality and effectiveness of mechanisms and institutions in charge of preventing violence, including sexual and gender-based violence, and addressing issues of protection of civilians in conflict and post-conflict situations. It has 4 main objectives; Outcome 1: To enhance the Capacities of African Institutions Working in the Areas of Peace and Security and Human Rights to Mainstream Gender into the Continental Peace and Security Agenda. Outcome2: To strengthen advocacy efforts, Partnership and promoting research and dialogue on Gender, Peace and Security. Outcome 3: To strengthen Women's roles in peace and security in Africa. Outcome 4: To prevent and respond to vulnerabilities of women, men, and children in time of conflict and post-conflict situations, and ending impunity.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The joint financial arrangement (JFA) agreement that Sweden and Austria has signed with the African Union Commission (AUC) for the implementation of GPSP was terminated at the inception phase (as of December 2015) due to lack of proper management, reporting, accountability and inter and intra-departmental coordination at AUC amongst other factors. The program has operated under provisional budgets, work plans which were not approved by the Steering Committee and without a comprehensive program document. The external audit which was required to be undertaken annually were not done. Accordingly, the JFA partners have decided to terminate the program while the finance department of AUC stopped release of funds as of January 2016 due to the lack of a legal basis (terminated MoU). Therefore, no activities were implemented in 2016. When the reports were finally submitted in March 2017, they were assessed to be very poor quality. There was no alignment between the narrative and financial report as well as the work plan. It also provided list of fragmented activities without clear indication how it relates with or contribute to the objectives of the program. Generally, the reports did not meet the reporting standards set out in the JFA and bilateral agreements with the respective donors. The partners have provided feedback on the reports and demanded for revised version which has never been submitted. Therefore, it is difficult to draw any example of concrete results from the program but the following could be highlighted from the report as processes that the program has contributed to, - Supported the launch of the board of the Inter-Governmental Authority on Development (IGAD)'s Women and Peace Forum (IWPF). - Organized national level consultations on women's leadership and participation in conflict resolution, peacekeeping, post-conflict reconstruction peace building, peacekeeping and sustainable development in collaboration with African Union Liason Offices in South Sudan, Burundi, Libya, CAR, Madagascar. - Supported the advocacy efforts of the AU Special Envoy on Women Peace and Security - Produced publications entitled, 'The Easy-to-Read Guide on AMISOM policy on Prevention and Response to Sexual Exploitation and Abuse.' and 'Women and Girls, HIV/AIDS and Conflict: Situation Analysis of 11 Selected Conflict and Post-Conflict Countries in Africa.'
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
